term.title: cationic polymer

item.text: Polymer composed of positively charged macromolecules and an equivalent amount of counter-anions.

notes.item: If a substantial fraction of constitutional units carries positive charges, then a cationic polymer is a polyelectrolyte.
The positive charges may be fixed on groups located in main chains as in an ionene or in pendant groups.
The term cationic polymer should not be used to denote a polymer prepared by cationic polymerization.

sources.item: PAC, 2006, 78, 2067. 'Terminology of polymers containing ionizable or ionic groups and of polymers containing ions (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 2069 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200678112067)
